alert.note: Alert for Smyth; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 5:38PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory In Effect for Tazewell and Smyth Counties Until 845 PM EDT This Evening... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from showers and thunderstorms is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Smyth and Tazewell. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Small creeks and streams could experience sharp rises during the next few hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms across the region. This heavy rain could lead to flooding of low-lying, poor drainage, and other normally flod prone areas. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, especially across southern Tazewell and northern Smyth counties during the past hour or so. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected. The threat for flooding in this region is increasing. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Beech Fork, Bluestone River, Blue Spring Creek, Clinch River, Campbell Creek, Big Creek and Burkes Garden Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will increase the threat for flooding within the advisory area. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Marion... Richlands... Bluefield... Tazewell... Saltville... Chilhowie... Cedar Bluff... - For additional information on stream, creek, river, and lake levels please go to our web site located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary/Preparedness Statements: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
